description: News, reaction and information about the impact of coronavirus on the Bailiwick of Guernsey.
title: Coronavirus: Guernsey updates 20-24 April
title_page: Coronavirus: Guernsey updates 20-24 April - BBC News
maintext:
People who have recently lost their jobs now have access to an initiative designed to help them get back into work, the States has announced.
The Career Advantage Programme is a joint venture by the Job Centre and the College of Further Education (CFE).
It will will seek to:
Support people to clearly recognise gain a recognised qualification or offer them coaching and CV update skills
Identify skills gaps for further development, such as maths and English
Explore future progression or retraining opportunities
Support job application processes, for example developing CVs, letters of application and interview skills
The support will be offered virtually by staff from the Job Centre and CFE lecturers, while the college is closed.
Its aim is to give those currently out of work the best chance to regain employment either during this ongoing crisis or later, the States said.
Anyone interested in getting involved can contact the Job Centre via email or phone on 07839 288985.
Louise Misselke, principal of the CFE, said they would support anyone who has "suddenly lost their job" in these "strange and challenging times".
Ms Misselke said: "The team at the College are ready to work with anyone who finds themselves in this position and who needs support to recognise the years of experience and skill they have got from previous employment."
